intro: Psorospermum humblotii, commonly known as the Madagascar hibiscus, is a flowering plant native to Madagascar. It belongs to the Malvaceae family and is characterized by its showy, five-petaled flowers that range in color from white to pink. The plant has lance-shaped leaves and produces woody capsules as its fruit. It thrives in tropical climates and is often found in moist, shaded areas of the forest understory. Due to its ornamental value, it is occasionally cultivated in botanical gardens and as a houseplant.
